questions.question: What is the primary objective of Learning Unit 9?

choices: Local plant fibers for cordage making

questions.question: What material is suggested for creating cordage in the activities section?

choices: Learn to swim in rough seas
Learn to make cordage from natural fibers
questions.answer: Learn to make cordage from natural fibers

questions.question: What type of knot is used to create a fixed loop at the end of a rope?
Which lashing technique is best for joining two poles at right angles?
What is the term for the active end of a rope used to tie a knot?
Which knot is commonly used to join two ropes of different diameters?
What is the purpose of the taut-line hitch?
choices: To secure a rope around a pole

questions.question: What is cordage?
choices: String or rope, especially made from plant fibers
questions.answer: String or rope, especially made from plant fibers

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a part of a rope mentioned in the key vocabulary?

choices: To attach poles or sticks together
questions.answer: To attach poles or sticks together

choices: Write an essay on knot history
Create a video tutorial on knot tying
Create a knot board with 5 knots
questions.answer: Create a knot board with 5 knots

questions.question: Which traditional Timorese element is students asked to research for homework?
choices: Traditional use of rope or cordage
questions.answer: Traditional use of rope or cordage

questions.question: What is a bight in rope terminology?
choices: A curved section or slack part between the two ends of a rope
questions.answer: A curved section or slack part between the two ends of a rope

questions.answer: They are readily available in the wilderness
